noun.definition: The health, happiness, and fortunes of a person or group.
noun.example: They are concerned about the welfare of the children.

noun.definition: Statutory procedure or social effort designed to promote the basic physical and material well-being of people in need.
noun.example: The protection of rights to education, housing, and welfare.

verb.definition: To provide with welfare or assistance (rare/non-standard).
verb.example: The organization welfared the displaced families.

usage_examples: The state has a duty to ensure the welfare of its citizens.
He donated money to animal welfare charities.
